intro: Freziera attenuata, commonly known as the narrowleaf freziera, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Freziera attenuata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
